item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:2, topic:40006”]Specify ListBox.TabWidth first.
Even then, it’s kinda crappy. (you’ll see)
Too bad SCAR doesn’t have TListView :’([/quote]
Lol ya, Listviews are loads better than listboxes ^^

item.title: Trouble with a listbox with more than 1 column
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I have a listbox with 2 columns, and I would like to know how to add values to it.

I know to separate the listbox into columns all you do is execute this code:
ListBox1.Columns := 2;

I looked on a tutorial in delphi, and they said to separate each value with a ^I when adding values like this.
ListBox1.Items.Add(‘First’^I’Second’);

But it didn’t work. I also tried separating the values with a comma instead of a ^I but that also did not work. Any idea? Or is it even possible in scar? Thank you.

Here is the tutorial where I got the ^I from if you’re curious. http://delphi.about.com/cs/adptips2000/a/bltip1200_3.htm

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: Trouble with a listbox with more than 1 column
